benchmark_details.name: MAIA (Multimodal AI Assessment)
benchmark_details.overview: MAIA is a native-Italian benchmark that assesses the reasoning abilities of visual language models on videos, through two aligned tasks: a visual statement verification task and an open-ended visual question-answering task, evaluating models' consistency and understanding in a culturally representative context.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate the reasoning abilities of visual language models in video contexts, emphasizing the integration of understanding and generation tasks.

data.source: 100 short videos from YouTube Italy reflecting various aspects of Italian culture.
data.annotation: Manually annotated by qualified native speakers, with semi-automatic validation checks.

methodology.calculation: Aggregate accuracy rewards models for consistent correct responses across both tasks.
methodology.interpretation: Higher aggregate accuracy indicates better understanding and generation capabilities in VLMs.
methodology.validation: Qualitative analysis and revision of the data.
